newsArray.title: South Africa make three changes to Playing XI for second Pakistan Test
creator: A Sports
newsArray.description: CAPE TOWN: Cricket South Africa (CSA) on Thursday revealed their Playing XI for the second Test against Pakistan, scheduled to be played here at Newlands from 3 January. South Africa are leading the two-match series after a thrilling two-wicket victory in the opening Test in Centurion. With this victory, they confirmed their berth for the [...]The post South Africa make three changes to Playing XI for second Pakistan Test appeared first on ASports.tv.

newsArray.title: Shubman Gill Net Worth: Cricket's Rising Star's Stellar Career And Luxurious Lifestyle
creator: ABP News Bureau
newsArray.description: Indian cricket star Shubman Gill is making waves both on and off the field. At just 25, the Gujarat Titans captain has built a lavish lifestyle backed by a substantial net worth.Shubman Gill's Net Worth and CareerShubman Gill, a mainstay in the Indian cricket team across all formats, boasts a net worth of approximately Rs 34 crore. His cricketing journey began with the Under-19 World Cup in 2018, and he has since cemented his place as one of India's most dependable players.Shubman Gill's Income SourcesBCCI Contract: Grade A player, Gill earns Rs 5 crore annually.IPL Salary: Gujarat Titans pay him Rs 8 crore per season.Annual Earnings: Between Rs 10-12 crore, combining match fees and endorsements.Brand Endorsements: Collaborations with global brands like NIKE, JBL, and Gillette.Other Ventures: Gill expanded his horizons by lending his voice to Marvel's Spider-Man film, adding a unique feather to his cap.Shubman Gill's Luxurious LifestyleShubman Gill's lifestyle mirrors his success. He resides in a lavish house in Punjab and owns a collection of premium vehicles, including a Range Rover SUV, Mahindra Thar, and Mercedes Benz E350.Shubman Gill's Career MilestonesGill has achieved several milestones early in his career:Under-19 World Cup: Played a key role in India's 2018 triumph.IPL Champion: Part of the title-winning Gujarat Titans team in 2022.Shubman Gill Among Four Indian Cricketers Allegedly Involved in Rs 450 Crore Fraud CaseA major controversy has emerged involving four prominent players from IPL franchise Gujarat Titans. Shubman Gill, Rahul Tewatia, Mohit Sharma, and Sai Sudharsan have reportedly been implicated in a Rs 450 crore chit fund scam.According to reporters, Shubman Gill, captain of Gujarat Titans, allegedly invested Rs 1.95 crore in the fraudulent scheme, the highest among the four players. The other three players are reported to have made smaller investments.(Disclaimer: This story is based on media reports. ABP Live does not independently claim all facts mentioned.)

newsArray.title: Dhoni, Rohit, and the 'quiet' goodbyes
creator: Amit Kumar
newsArray.description: Rohit Sharma, India's T20 World Cup-winning captain, is expected to quietly end his Test career following underwhelming performances. His situation mirrors the abrupt retirements of legends like MS Dhoni, Rahul Dravid, VVS Laxman, and R Ashwin, marking another significant departure in Indian cricket history. Rohit’s recent Test form has been underwhelming, averaging just 6.2 across his last three matches in Australia and 10.93 in the past nine Tests. Combined with India’s struggles in the current World Test Championship cycle, his place in the squad had come under question.
